Review.Titre: Not Recommended
Review.Contenu: Basic software. Very slow, and there are not a lot of features available. Customer service is bad; re-importing credit gives inaccurate results. Overall, this software is not good to use for credit repair businesses. I will not recommend this software. and the price per month is very high. It is not worth it. You will lose a lot of clients if you use this software. No notifications when stuff is due or past due; no good communication source with the software to communicate with your clients beside messaging. Not recommended.

Review.Titre: These reviews are fake
Review.Contenu: These reviews are fake, Read who wrote them and you'll see they were paid fake reviews. Plus they are credit repair is actually being sued big time

Review.Titre: Dissappointment
Review.Contenu: Thus far not good because I have been held up for over a month, while paying for a service that is not benefiting me. An no one seems to really care.When onboarding the system would not let me move forward until I signed up with Credit Score Hero. My first red flag because I was force into the subcription to move forward.As I discovered using Credit Score Hero/Advantage scoring model is inaccurate, as it gave me a 103 point score difference than the FICO scoring model, that most all lenders use. Which I only found out when applying for a refinance on my home, and I learned auto lenders also use FICO.So I cancelled my subscription and signed up with IdentityIQ FICO option.Why Credit Score Hero would have Advantage as their only option makes no sense. Not logical to provide clients scores so much different than what a lender is going to pull. Only serves to upset people as it has me. That is not being a Hero!Yet CRC/CSH (Credit Score Hero) seems determined to make us use Advantage scoring model by making errors pop up when trying to use affiliate links?I can't import my own credit report, much less a client. I have tried 2 different affiliates that use FICO with same error.  So why should I be paying for a service I can't use accurately?Bella in your very slow customer support system says my log in credentials are wrong causing the problem. 1. Your site does not ask for the affiliates login credentials. 2. I provided Bella my log in credentials and same problem and no further response.Seems your company is determined on making people use Credit Score Hero. To what end? It has to be upsetting a lot of customers once they apply for financing and find out their score is actually much lower. Which is bad for the industry's reputation. Credit Repair Cloud seems to have a great platform for processing yet I can't get there to actually find out. CRC seems uninterested in allowing affiliate links to work. The CRC/CSH site even highly discourages using affiliates.I just don't get how CRC/CSH benefits long term.Short of whom ever is reading this being able to resolve my issue very soon, I will be shopping for another platform to process my 20 plus waiting list of clients waiting for me to get started.

Review.Titre: Violation of Federal Law?
Review.Contenu: **𝐔𝐏𝐃𝐀𝐓𝐄** 4/21/2023My questions are genuine and designed to ensure that I do not start down a path that isn't legally viable. Your sidestepping and clear desire to avoid the question is concerning!There is still no clear answer here regarding the business model being promoted in your ads and on social media which is clearly designed to promote collecting fees immediately from clients upon signing them up for services.Simple Question: Do you promote Credit Repair Businesses collecting fees for services on an ongoing monthly basis?Simple Question: You clearly recommend that your trainees (customers) use "Billsby payment solution" for taking credit card payments because as you state "PayPal, Stripe, and other common gateways cannot be used to receive credit repair payments or ACH Transfers for credit repair" - WHY do these payments services not allow collection of payments for "credit repair"?FINALLY: These are valid questions that you as a company promoting this business model should be readily able and prepared to answer.**𝐔𝐏𝐃𝐀𝐓𝐄 𝐀𝐅𝐓𝐄𝐑 𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐏𝐀𝐍𝐘 𝐑𝐄𝐒𝐏𝐎𝐍𝐒𝐄**The response below completely sidesteps the issues in my review𝗙𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 & 𝗙𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁This company deleted my question on its Facebook page and blocked me from commenting - WHY? was it to hide the Federal Law Question?NOTE: In their answer below they clearly place the responsibility upon any using their system to comply with the law𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐝The company does not answer the question about the Violation of Federal law under the Credit Repair Organizations Act which prevents the collection of up front fees which Credit Repair Cloud PROMOTES𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐫𝐝They have no telephone contact number and did not provide one in response to my review because they can't!--------------------------------------------------------𝐎𝐫𝐢𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐢𝐞𝐰Looking for answers. The company has no telephone number so everything is through electronic communication. When I attempted to get answers on their social media platform they blocked me from commenting which basically provided me with my answer. Here's the question that the company wouldn't answer.In researching this opportunity I came across the Credit Repair Organizations Act (Federal Law). The Act bars companies offering credit repair services from demanding advance payment.How does this affect this business model?How do you structure a credit repair business that creates revenue and complies with the law?

Review.Titre: Horrible experience
Review.Contenu: I purchased 3 courses on Feb 8th 22 and never started the courses as I came under a life threatening, debilitating, car accident where a semi truck hit me on my way to work. I lost my job, car, and physically was injured. Desperate I remember I paid a good amount of money for the 3 courses and contacted CRC to request a refund and they denied my request saying it was more than 30 days since I had paid. Instead they opt to tell me don't worry you will have the courses for life! Heartless inconsiderate training company that only cares for more money in their own pocket! Stay away don't buy the upsells and tell your friends!

Review.Titre: Blatant Lies in Their Digital Marketing Efforts
Review.Contenu: I've been doing internet marketing since it was being invented. 20+ years full-time.So trust me, I get it.I love Daniel and his story but boy has CRC gone off the deep end in believing that PURE DECEPTION IS OK BECAUSE IT'S JUST A PERSUASION TECHNIQUE.So disappointed in Oregon.

Review.Contenu: The only reason I’m giving a bad review is because I didn’t like how they handled me I reached out to the team letting them know that I’d had a catastrophic personal event and if I could get additional time in the program they emailed me saying no if I didn’t finish in the time allotted I’d have to purchase the course again when it’s available I think people and businesses should have empathy anyway but especially during a pandemic when most people have felt it’s effects other than that very informative

Then they upgraded my account and charged my credit card without authorization/permission. Getting support to respond in a timely manner makes their customer service horrible. No phone support. Very wary of their business practices.

Use dispute fox and save hundreds. Btw the millionaire club doesn’t use crc letters and they have used their own system of letters. Don’t be scammed.

Review.Titre: You don’t learn caca
Lots of Flash, Terrible Service, Questionable Reviews
Review.Contenu: I was very excited to enroll and even paid for their 14 day challenge. I was moving over from another service that has not aged gracefully and didn't have the bells and whistles of CRC.All started out great and they do a wonderful job of providing some of the basic training from within the 14 day challenge which will take up 2-3 weeks of your 30 day trial.If you are starting out with no clients the onboarding and doing your first client doesn't seem that bad. However if you have been in the business for any time at all and are wanting to move clients over they don't really train on that.I had questions, lot of questions..How do I bring my existing 200+ clients over manually?What happens if a client doesn't want to use one of the preferred monitoring services? How are files entered manually without disrupting existing clients with "thanks for signing up emails"?What happens and how do you handle future rounds?Can you send out different letters based on the results, if so how?I had these and lots of other questions. The only way to get answers was to email them. No chat support, extremely limited phone support. For me to get all my questions answered would probably take a month and I'll explain why below.I asked if i could talk to someone live as I just had too many questions. They said sure but each call would be limited to 15 minutes. I couldn't imagine I would be limited to 15 minutes "for real" so i made the appt.Call was scheduled for the next day at 1:00pm, I was waiting and didn't receive a call. I got a call at 1:10 and answered it and it wasn't them (it was a prospect) While i was talking they called about 1:20 I called back moments later and was told to reschedule the appt.I was upset as it was the caller that was late. I tried to complain via email and all they could do is apologize and setup another meeting a couple days later.I then knew that the 15 minutes was a hard 15 minutes and wanted to complain further and plead my case for more time.I emailed and even posted in the facebook group. The email was responded to within 24 hours with a form letter apologizing and offering the 15 minutesMy facebook post was quickly deleted with the reason that support questions are to be sent to support and not to the facebook group. Before the post was removed I received messages from several people saying the software was good but the service was terrible, 2 of which recommended going elsewhere before I got too deep.Prior to enrolling I did read reviews and most were very good and I used them to help guide my decision. I later found out that most of the reviews were probably incentivized as when I finished the 14 day challenge I was offered the following.Give us a review and the best review will get 1 free month of service ($179 value) and even if you are not the best review you will get a $49 credit. At the time I gave them a good review because I liked the promise of the software but had to rescind and replace once i knew the truthI now know why they got so many good reviews. I did stop everything and moved on to a different service that had all the same bells and whistles and after 2 weeks have experienced overwhelming customer service from the new company. and they are actually cheaperI think this company puts on a show during the trial period with just enough to get new people started knowing that moving and learning a new tool is very difficult. They probably push their training that includes 6 months of software to get you embedded even longer.I would say to stay away from this company if you want to be in the credit repair business long term, especially if you are a new business.BTW - I've been in the business full time for over 13 years and will be in it many more.

Review.Titre: Honestly i feel as if i was scammed
Review.Contenu: Honestly i feel as if i was scammed. this could have been taught in about 4-5 hours. super simple material. i feel i wasted 2 weeeks. i feel as if it was a way to drain 2 weeks from your 1st month of the software cost. i understand you have to pay for the software and its well worth it. too much stuff to promote crc. i suggest you buy software and learn clickfunnels

Review.Titre: Based off Option, Not Fact
Review.Contenu: The book states a lot of opinion to be fact. It's great for learning how to make money in the business of credit repair, but not so much in "changing live". Which is the author's battle cry.

Review.Titre: Needs Attention
Review.Contenu: I signed up with incredible excitement. This company is legit with outstanding reviews. Upon signing up, they talk heavily about such a seamless process and their tech-support is always available and unfortunately that is not a fact and as of this writing I have yet to be helped appropriately I had software issues in the beginning I graduated yesterday I went to move into the master class when I went to buy the material  message pops up saying email address did not exist. My new business email which supposedly was changed did not exist nor did the email that I originally signed up with within their system exist . I called again and left a detailed voice message and instead of getting a return phone call I get a text message telling me the complete opposite of what the tech that told me before who supposedly changed my business address as primary . One of the technicians did not even know how to get around this software for this particular program, let alone help me with my issues. And within that same phone call expressing that I can’t purchase materials the tech didn’t even address that. I feel like most of their tech-support flippantly respond back and just shoot off a email without reading or comprehending the true nature of the problem with half the time in my situation required a telephone call. It has been an absolute nightmare. My question has been. What do they expect me to do with continuous ongoing issues that I have no control over it is coming from their side and there’s no human to talk to  no supervisor to request but yet I’m trying to build a business with this very company. In the Facebook group that you are participating in when you enroll I was called out on some of the life coaching calls because I was posting my issues asking for help and the only way I got help was posting them in the Facebook group and was called out for that. Not one of the administrators in my Facebook group even attempted to help Not in any way shape or form. Nobody did nothing still putting out there that I’m having these issues and have been ignored, and the one technician who shot back with an email that didn’t even resolve my issue. I am not seeing or feeling the level of support that I’ve heard when I first enrolled and went through this training. Their level of support is talked about repeatedly yet they don’t disclose it’s only done by texting and that does not always work and the fact that I cannot reach a human is beyond frustrating. At this point I am not heard and my issues are not being resolved. More issues are coming through and it’s not due to me. It’s due to their technicians whatever they’re not doing right is completely causing a huge ripple and my inability to move forward and practice what I just paid for within this course

Review.Titre: CRC Overall
Review.Contenu: CRC, has a great product, however they lead you to assume your a getting a "credit business in a box" I understand that they have people from many different states buying into their product, however they should list the requirements for each state upfront.

Review.Titre: The support is horrendous and that is…
Review.Contenu: The support is horrendous and that is putting it lightly. I am supposed to run a business where I am unable to contact a person for help. I have to send an email and wait days for a response. That is not the level of customer that I give my customers nor should I accept it in return. Even after you make a dispute on the same issue no one will call you they keep sending you different links or videos to try to figure it out. You also do not get a mentor you have to depend on the Facebook group for guidance. The original video said you would be provided a mentor not that Facebook would be your mentor it also said that you would be able to "speak with support for help.

Review.Titre: the video's does not answer the…
Review.Contenu: the video's does not answer the essential questions that I have about this business to my satisfaction

Review.Titre: I like Daniel's passion to help people
Review.Contenu: I like Daniel's passion to help people, help people. I like the software. I got a little lost implementing the process.  Also see challenges multiple times was very confusing.  The repetition of signing up, for onboardind, watching videos was very confusing.  I would say didn't I thus already. 14 days is a lot going on to remember, so when I git a request to sign up ot do something, I didn't remember until I started playing the video and it sound familiar.  I'm reading the book now and I plan to add my family. I added myself and didn't have any negative, and unspecified inquiries,  so I could not send out disputes. I appreciate this opportunity you have provided. When I get some money I will buy your $997 business starter, but currently I'm maxed out. But again tjus is a great opportunity to change lives and I am on board.

Review.Titre: Follow up on the next Challenge date
Review.Contenu: I was interested in the Challenge, however I realized the holidays were right around the corner. Knowing this, I can easily assume it could continue immediately after the holiday season. I wish that someone could of reached out to confirm it.

Review.Titre: Very thorough
Review.Contenu: Very thorough. I wish the live calls were at more convenient times for those who work. I think evening 8/9pm would be helpful for people with kids, or jobs. I wish there was a way to speak with someone one on one to ask specific questions that may not have been clear or answered watching the trainings. Other than that, I appreciate all the resources provided

Review.Titre: it was ok
Review.Contenu: it was ok. basic. intro to sign folks up for the $997 program.  always need to be finding new customers & old customers fall off once helped. Didn't like it was suppose to be 14 days & turned it into 21 days. that's misinformation. the 1st week was a waste of precious time. stick to actually making it 14 days for folks.

Review.Titre: The first week was a complete waste of…
Review.Contenu: The first week was a complete waste of time. I get the the whole thing about “Belief Week” but it wasn’t worth a weeks worth of time. The only week that was actually informational was the second week. The third week was completely chuck full of redundancies and replays of the same materials. I appreciate the opportunity but the course should more organized and have all steps in sequential order and make sure that we aren’t learning the old doftware but the actual up to date software.

Review.Titre: They were quick to respond however
Review.Contenu: They were quick to respond however, the program was mis advertised.  You should only have to pay what the advertising says and not a ton of addons that could end up costing hundreds more.  I would have loved to try the program at the $47 advertised price but once you pay for that you are offered a bunch of addons that cost a bunch more.  Not only that, choosing one of the options caused my card to be charged twice.

Review.Titre: I really like the engagement and the…
Review.Contenu: I really like the engagement and the spirit of everyone, however I relaxed the lack of detail on some days and very little review. I think there was time that could have been well spent of details of topics instead of a snippet of the topic. This will help credit hero’s be better prepared when dealing with clients. Thanks

Review.Titre: It’s not too bad if you don’t have to contact customer service.
Review.Contenu: The software is pretty good. But the customer service isn’t that good. It’s hard to get in contact with people to help you solve problems in a timely manner.

Review.Titre: I would give 5 stars, but…
Review.Contenu: I would give 5 stars, but my initial start with CRC did not start off well. I signed up for the 30-day free trial and in less than an hour, my account was cancelled. About 2 days later, I learned that an error occurred during a recent system update and cancelled some member accounts. It took a week to get it resolved. I can say that the support rep handling my help desk ticket was amazing. Ramario stayed in contact and kept me updated. The “clock” for my 30-day free trial was reset once I was able to log in.  My concern is that it should not take an entire week to fix a scripting error.  I know things can happen, but it’s not a good feeling not being able to access the system in 7 days. A day or a few hours top, but not an entire week.

Review.Titre: I actually wish we spent more time on…
Review.Contenu: I actually wish we spent more time on the drop down menu when disputing each item for some reason I need more help there and can't get anyone to explain them to me

Review.Titre: It was all over the place to me
Review.Contenu: It was all over the place to me. Too many emails on how to start the program. Multiple! Caused confusion for me. No real contact person other than email. Help via email was helpful. I felt it was confusion on steps to enroll. Once enrolled start steps to began only no other emails in regards to what’s free or training. Just get me started step 1 to step whatever. Then once started just contact phone or emails. The follow up on how things are going and any problems suggest training. Too much too fast up front. But I do think it’s a good program. What little I was able to comprehend.Thanks

Review.Titre: Good but could use improvements
Review.Contenu: I don’t feel it’s a bad program at all, but honestly the information was very confusing at times, because it was all over the place. First I was in the 14 day challenge, then the basic disputing course, then the software certification, and some other things. With so much jumping from section to section it became very difficult to understand where I was at sometimes. I was so confused that I fell behind ( due to frustration ) but I caught back up after I figured things out. On the other hand, the staff did a VERY good job at keeping me motivated and confident throughout the whole process. They actually made me believe I can get this done and I am determined to get it done. The motivational aspect of the program is very important. The best part of the program is when they actually started teaching you about the software, by going through the steps on screen. They made THAT part very simple to understand, and I am confident I can use it without guidance. I gave it 3 stars  not because I think the program is bad, but because it can use some improvements in the way they teach it. Other than that, I’m ready to start my credit repair business 💪🏾

Review.Titre: I would of given 5 stars BUT at the end…
Review.Contenu: I would of given 5 stars BUT at the end of the challenge the certificate has my last name wrong. Should be Davis NOT David. No way for me to correct on my own. This is just a mistake that should have not happen.

Review.Contenu: I had a lot of great videos to watch but am more of a live person learner. Especially with computer systems and questions.

Review.Contenu: I really wish there was hands on training!  Trust me when I say, technology is not my things!

Review.Titre: I need some help on setting my website…
Review.Contenu: I need some help on setting my website up and running

Review.Titre: The training lacked two things
Review.Contenu: The training lacked one critical facet and that is the law concerning credit repair. They say you can charge a monthly fee but that goes against the TSR. You are going to get a lot of people sued. You also didn't mention rebucketing in the curriculum which everyone should know about if they are doing credit repair.

Review.Titre: I wish that there were more examples…
Review.Contenu: I wish that there were more examples given for the topics reviewed for a better understanding of the actual Credit Repair as opposed to understanding the program.  And I was extremely disappointed that the end of the 14 days we were baited into the hour and 45 minute "Live Master class".  It is a prerecording and It is a one hour and forty five minute infomercial of why you need to buy the master class.  It wasted over an hour of my workday that I could have dedicated to working or actually doing further education in Credit repair.  Not watching a commercial.

Review.Titre: Awesome program I just wish I could…
Review.Contenu: Awesome program I just wish I could have gave it more of my undivided attention. The knowledge is in abundance for sure. You just have to be ready for it and don’t think your going to become an overnight success. Credit repair takes time and so does building any business so my advice is so this on the side until it grows out of control. Then full time along with other products and services. Great program over all though.

Review.Titre: The concept is good
Review.Contenu: The concept is good, the system is great, but the sales emails are extreme. CRC sends 5+ upsale emails daily. I was getting emails asking me to sign up for the 14 day challenge although I was already signed up. The 14 day challenge consist of 3 topic, I signed up thinking it would be beneficial to me as I am new to CRC, wrong! 2 of the three topic that is taught in the 14 day challenge I had already completed from the free education and already had my certificate. This was a complete waste of money and due to this I will not be buying any "upsells" CRC offers.

Review.Titre: I love the system it’s a bit expensive…
Review.Contenu: I love the system it’s a bit expensive but I mean I payed for it last month and this month I just feel for me not having as many clients it’s hard to pay almost $200 for the system. I love the fb group it’s very helpful. The credit repair challenge I feel was more for someone who has never done credit repair.

Review.Titre: It is good information
Review.Contenu: It is good information, just not well presented. The presentation made it hard to follow along in a systematic way. I was left feeling as if I missed half of the material.

Review.Titre: I love this program!
Review.Contenu: I love this program. My only concern is that my learning ability takes more one on one and direct training as opposed to group virtual. But yes this opportunity is fabulous!

Review.Titre: What I appreciate about Credit Repair…
Review.Contenu: What I appreciate about Credit Repair Cloud is the sharing of knowledge,  experience and information needed to help novices to the industry learn and utilize resources.  I took off a star because the monthly cost of the cloud is expensive for me as a new business.A.Miah

Review.Titre: Poor customer service
Review.Contenu: I've owned my own credit repair company for 15 years.  Wanted to automate things since we continue to grow.  If you import credit reports through IdentityIQ or the other companies they recommend, be aware that the dispute letters that you generate will not list the name of the collection company furnishing the data.  Instead, they'll list the original creditor (hospital, doctor's office etc).  After waiting 5 days for an answer on this from customer support, I was told that the only way to work around that is to manually change the letters, which completely defeats the purpose of speeding up the dispute letter creation.Poor customer service.

Review.Titre: The course was good for beginners
Review.Contenu: The course was good for beginners. However, I had a few issues and I believe that they do not practice what they preach.

Review.Titre: I like the cloud, I don't like being double charged with no refund
Review.Contenu: I really enjoy using credit repiar cloud. I only gave it 3 stars instead of 5 because i wish they were a bit more user friendly and I also wish they would not have double charged me for 4 months by calling me and telling me my credit card on file needed updated. I told them it should be on auto-pay and they said my card didn't go through so maybe it is expired or something. In efforts to avoid my account being shut off and losing all my current clients, I hurriedly gave them a new card. Come to find out, this opened a new account for me and I was being charged on both accounts now. When I called and explained the situation, they said, sorry, you only have 30 days to dispute a charge and since its been so long (4 months before I noticed) we will not refund the entire 4 months. I explained that They could see that I was not processing clients through the secondary account and had been plenty busy on the original account and that should prove that it was not opened purposefully. They have stuck with the fact that I didn't let them know within 30 days so I was stuck paying it. They agreed to refund 2 months of the fees. I'm still waiting for a call back from a higher up. Higher than the supervisor.

Review.Titre: The information was great
Review.Contenu: The information was great. I learned a lot and it help me set up about 75% of my business. More time is needed to go over the merchant accounts and billing.  After all, although we are in this to help others out in every way that we can, we cannot continue to support ourselves if our business is not making a living profit. I was also not happy with belief week. While I get it that some people need the help to believe in themselves, I do not think it needed a full week. I almost asked for a refund after the 2nd day because it felt like an MLM seminar and I am not looking to join one. I am very glad that I didn't ask for one now that I have finished the course. Although the Referal Program was mentioned for the Credit Hero Challenge, I feel that more time could have been put into the training side of this. It would have been a great way to create income as people went thru the 14 day challenge. If belief week started as a day or two and then transitioned into teaching how to market the course as a way to "earn while you learn" over the next 14 days, I believe it would have been a 5 Star course. Finally, I wish that more time would have been spent in setting up the payment side of the software. It seemed that in the Software certification course it showed Billsby and then breezed on past how to actually set up and what the process needed to be to get approved for a merchant account and then the a billing account.

Review.Titre: Just my 5 Star opinion
Review.Contenu: CRC covered everything regarding credit repair, most of all made it easy to understand. I have worked on my own credit these past 2 years going from 609 to 728 as of today, but if I knew then what I know now it may have been less than 2 years, but it is what it is. The CRC software is excellent and easy to navigate, but most of all makes the whole process move smoothly. The additional books, and PDFs that were given are vital to success, with a lot of useful text, information, do's and dont's, all covering each step of the process. The only issue I see is human error when entering information but that is fixable. The course work was repetitive at times but essential to understand how to do credit repair and be successful. I would recommend others take this Challenge even if it is only to fix their credit problems. For me, 5 Stars it has everything I need to move forward.

That’s why I would like to take the time to leave this review just to tell Vida thank you so much for understanding my concern and going out your way to addressing provide a solution and such desperate trying times when you still want to operate and do right by your customers . Thank you soooo much vida for your help. !! Things will not continue to be the same it will get better and I’ll be able to manage my payments more responsibly!!! Thank you again CRC !! :)
